bibl.author: W. J. McAvoy
bibl.title: W. J. McAvoy to Walt Whitman, 29 November 1868
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p: The last time that I met you in Brooklyn I was speaking to you in regard to my appointment for Sailmaker in U.S. Navy.
And you told me to write to you in washington. And state to you how the thing was.

In 1862, i was recommended by Moses H. Grinnell of N.Y.New York to the Navy Department. was examined and passed to the Board, for Master Sail Maker, and i remain on the to be appointed Sec of the Navy's office ever since.

as you are in washington i will ask of you a favourfavor of looking after it for me, and see what you can do towards getting it for me
For it has been the height of my ambition. to get the position And by getting it. Will put me out of misery. And my mind content any further information Any of the clerks in the Sec of Navy office will give you. . I have writenwritten to the Department severlseveral times in regard to it. no use it want to be backed up by Some body besides me
hopeinghoping that you will grant me the favourfavor i ask and that you may suceedsucceed I remain,

postscript.p: Please write and Direct your letter to No 27 Tallman St BrooknBrooklyn N.Y.New York
